sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"清楚的，明白的，明显的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: apparent, obvious, evident, clear, plain, distinct, definite, manifest
means: apparent ：强调显而易见或一想便知。这个词从动词appear派生而来，故有时含有表面如此而事实上未必的意味。
obvious ：语气较强，指极为明显，有目共睹，无需说明和论证。
evident ：指根据事实成为显然的。
clear ：普通用词，侧重清楚明白。
plain ：普通用词，含义与clear很接近，可通用，但plain着重简单明了，不复杂。
distinct ：较正式用词，指轮廓的清楚或定义、含义的明确，不会弄错。
definite ：语气肯定，着重明白无误，无可怀疑。
manifest ：语义较强，书面用词，强调一目了然，暗示不要任何推论就一清二楚。

sentence.Network_en: It rapidly became apparent that rock'n'roll was a very broad church indeed.
sentence.Network_cn: 摇滚乐实际无所不包，这一点很快就显而易见了。

sentence.Network_en: The person may become dizzy for no apparent reason.
sentence.Network_cn: 这类人可能会莫名其妙地感到头晕。

sentence.Network_en: The presence of a star is already apparent in the early film.
sentence.Network_cn: 在早期影片中已经显露出了明星相。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French aparant, from Latin apparent- 'appearing', from the verb apparere (see appear)

entry.tran: 貌似的；表面上的；似乎真实的
entry.def: An apparent situation, quality, or feeling seems to exist, although you cannot be certain that it does exist.

example.ex: I was a bit depressed by our apparent lack of progress...
example.tran: 我对我们看似缓慢的进展感到有些沮丧。

example.ex: There is at last an apparent end to the destructive price war.
example.tran: 这场惨烈的价格战貌似终于结束了。

entry.def: If something is apparent to you, it is clear and obvious to you.

example.ex: It has been apparent that in other areas standards have held up well...
example.tran: 显然，这些标准在其他地区执行得很好。

example.ex: The presence of a star is already apparent in the early film.
example.tran: 在早期影片中已经显露出了明星相。

entry.def: If you say that something happens for no apparent reason, you cannot understand why it happens.

example.ex: The person may become dizzy for no apparent reason.
example.tran: 这类人可能会莫名其妙地感到头晕。

means.word_mean: 1. clearly apparent or obvious to the mind or senses;

sentences.sentence: "the effects of the drought are apparent to anyone who sees the parched fields"
"it is plain that he is no reactionary"

means.word_mean: 2. appearing as such but not necessarily so;

sentences.sentence: "for all his apparent wealth he had no money to pay the rent"

auth_sentence.content: But the totality is comprised of its apparent parts.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the totality is comprised of its apparent parts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the totality is comprised of its apparent parts.

auth_sentence.content: It seems apparent that BP put profit before safety.
auth_sentence.res_content: It seems apparent that BP put profit before safety.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It seems apparent that BP put profit before safety.

auth_sentence.content: De Hoop Scheffer described the apparent testing as unacceptable.
auth_sentence.res_content: De Hoop Scheffer described the apparent testing as unacceptable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: De Hoop Scheffer described the apparent testing as unacceptable.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =bring birth,表示"生产,生出小孩"; 2. =come in sight,表示"看见;出现"; 3. =get ready,表示"准备;安置"; 4. =equal,表示"平等"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 一胎多子的, 经产的, 非初产的, [植]多产的
stems_affixes.word_buile: multi多+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→多生产的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 初产的, 初次分娩的
stems_affixes.word_buile: primi=prim第一,最初+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→adj.初产的, 初次分娩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 每次产一个卵的; 每胎生一子的
stems_affixes.word_buile: uni单一+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→生出一个

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表面上的,貌似真实的;显然的,明明白白的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap一再+par看见;出现+ent……的→一再能看见→显而易见
trans横穿+par看见;出现+ent……的→横穿过去看得一样清楚→透明的
in不+separable[adj.可分离的, 可分的]→adj.不能分的
se分离+par置+able……的→adj.可分离的, 可分的
se分离+par置+ate表形容词→adj.分开的, 分离的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un无+prepare准备+ed……的→adj.无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可比较的, 比得上的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compare比较+able……的→adj.可比较的, 比得上的
compare比较+ative表形容词→adj.比较的, 相当的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 奇数的,不成对的,不平等
stems_affixes.word_buile: im不+parity[n.同等;奇偶]→adj.奇数的,不成对的,不平等
non不,无+par平等+eil→无平等的→无与伦比的
apparent显然的+ly表副词→adv.显然地
separate分开+ly表副词→adv.个别地;分离地
comparative[adj.比较的, 相当的]+ly表副词→adv.比较地, 相当地
par生产,生出小孩+ent……人→n.父母,母亲;[n.]双亲;父母

stems_affixes.value_cn: 透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃
stems_affixes.word_buile: transparent[[adj.透明的]]→n.透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃

stems_affixes.value_cn: 器械,器具,仪器;机构,组织
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap=ad+par准备;安置+atus表名词→准备好用的东西→设备
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
prepare准备+ation行为,过程→n.准备, 预备
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com一起+pari=par平等+son→一起平等→比较
dis不+parity同等→n.不同,差异
par平等→n.一对, 一双
par平等+ity表名词→n.同等;奇偶
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
pre预先+par准备;安置+e→预先准备好
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com共同+par平等+e→平等的放在一起→比较
dis不+par平等+age动词后缀→不平等对待→轻视

Sentence.sentence: The success of small schools is apparent in the listings.
The apparent struggles of the floundering (挣扎的）group have what Kapur calls a "hidden efficacy": they lead people to understand the deep structure of problems, not simply their correct solutions.
But, increasingly, this apparent diversity is becoming a mask for a new type of conformity.

means.word_mean: 显然的, 明白的, 清晰可见的

sentences.en: His guilt is apparent to all.

means.word_mean: 表面上的, 貌似(真实)的

sentences.en: The apparent truth was really a lie.
sentences.cn: 表面上看似实话, 实际上是个谎言。

jushi.english: The overseas visitors were much disappointed by this apparent lack of interest.
jushi.chinese: 由于这种明显无动于衷的表示,来访的外国客人感到非常失望。

jushi.english: My parents were concerned at my apparent lack of enthusiasm
jushi.chinese: 我对上学表现出不感兴趣，使父母担心。

jushi.english: There are one or two apparent discrepancies between the two reports.
jushi.chinese: 这两份报告在个别地方看上去有出入。
